snippet: Goldman Sachs and MetLife have agreed to release staff demographic information after New York City’s pension funds used their financial clout to demand public disclosure.
abstract: Goldman Sachs and MetLife agree to release racial and gender breakdowns of their staffs, responding to pressure from managers of New York City's pension funds; Comptroller John C Liu says the disclosures will allow city and stockholders to assess how serious firms are about issues related to the recruitment, retention and promotion of women and minorities.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs and MetLife have agreed to release staff demographic information after New York City’s pension funds used their financial clout to demand public disclosure.

headline.seo: Goldman Sachs and MetLife to Disclose Staff Diversity Data
headline.main: Two Giants of Finance Will Release Diversity Data
